intro: Aragallus spicatus, commonly known as the spicate aragallus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its upright, branched stems and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate environments, often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its roots are fibrous and adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Aragallus spicatus is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
